law.description: This rate laws supplies a constant rate independent of any species molecular concentration.
Single substrate linearized rate law. $g$ in the rate law is the unscaled elasticity, $dv/ds_o$.

parameter.name: vo
parameter.description: The reaction rate at the operating point, so

parameter.name: so
parameter.description: The operating point at which the orginal equation was linearized

law.display: v = V_m \frac{\alpha (1 + \alpha)^{n-1} + L c \alpha (1 + c \alpha)^{n-1}}{(1 + \alpha)^n + L(1 + c \alpha)^n}
v = V_m \frac{S/K_m \left(1 + S/K_m\right)^{n-1}}{\left(1 + S/K_m\right)^n + L \left( 1 + I/K_i\right)^n}
v = V_m \frac{S/K_m \left(1 + S/K_m\right)^{n-1}}{\left(1 + S/K_m\right)^n + L / \left( 1 + A/K_a\right)^n}

law.description: Reversible Hill model, see Rohwer and Hofmeyr, Kinetic and Thermodynamic Aspects of Enzyme Control and Regulation, J. Phys. Chem. B, 2010, 114 (49), pp 16280â€“16289, DOI: 10.1021/jp108412s

parameter.name: v_o
parameter.description: Reaction rate at the operating point

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: Level of enzyme concentration away from operatingpoint (if applicable)

parameter.name: so
parameter.description: Concentation of substate at operating point

parameter.name: vo
parameter.description: Reaction rate at the operating point

parameter.name: so
parameter.description: Substate concentration at the operating point

parameter.name: e
parameter.description: Elasticity coefficient of reaction rate with respect to species concentration

law.description: Simplified reversible MWC model with inhibitor
